Yama (Ethical Restraints).quote: अहिंसासत्यास्तेय ब्रह्मचर्यापरिग्रहा यमाः॥२.३०॥ - Non-violence, truthfulness, non-stealing, celibacy, non-possessiveness. (Sutra 2.30)

Niyama (Observances).quote: शौचसंतोषतपःस्वाध्यायेश्वरप्रणिधानानि नियमाः॥२.३२॥ - Purity, contentment, discipline, self-study, surrender to the divine. (Sutra 2.32)

Asana (Posture).quote: स्थिरसुखमासनम्॥२.४६॥ - Posture is steady and comfortable. (Sutra 2.46)

Pranayama (Breath Control).quote: तस्मिन्सति श्वासप्रश्वासयोर्गतिविच्छेदः प्राणायामः॥२.४९॥ - Regulation of breath follows steadiness of posture. (Sutra 2.49)

Pratyahara (Withdrawal of Senses).quote: स्वविषयासंप्रयोगे चित्तस्वरूपानुकार इवेन्द्रियाणां प्रत्याहारः॥२.५४॥ - Mastery over senses by withdrawing from their objects. (Sutra 2.54)

Dharana (Concentration).quote: देशबन्धश्चित्तस्य धारणा॥३.१॥ - Fixing consciousness on a single point. (Sutra 3.1)

Dhyana (Meditation).quote: तत्र प्रत्ययैकतानता ध्यानम्॥३.२॥ - Uninterrupted flow of awareness toward the object. (Sutra 3.2)

Samadhi (Absorption).quote: तदेवार्थमात्रनिर्भासं स्वरूपशून्यमिव समाधिः॥३.३॥ - Merging with the object of meditation; self dissolves. (Sutra 3.3)

Chitta Vrittis (Mind Modifications).quote: योगश्चित्तवृत्तिनिरोधः॥१.२॥ - Yoga is the cessation of mental fluctuations. (Sutra 1.2)

Kriya Yoga (Path of Action).quote: तपःस्वाध्यायेश्वरप्रणिधानानि क्रियायोगः॥२.१॥ - Austerity, self-study, and surrender to Ishvara constitute Kriya Yoga. (Sutra 2.1)

Ishvara Pranidhana (Surrender).quote: समाधिसिद्धिरीश्वरप्रणिधानात्॥२.४५॥ - Perfection in samadhi arises from surrender to the divine. (Sutra 2.45)

Vairagya (Detachment).quote: दृष्टानुश्रविकविषयवितृष्णस्य वशीकारसंज्ञा वैराग्यम्॥१.१५॥ - Freedom from craving sense pleasures. (Sutra 1.15)

Abhyasa (Practice).quote: तत्र स्थितौ यत्नोऽभ्यासः॥१.१३॥ - Steady, persistent effort to maintain stillness. (Sutra 1.13)

Kleshas (Afflictions).quote: अविद्यास्मितारागद्वेषाभिनिवेशाः क्लेशाः॥२.३॥ - Ignorance, egoism, attachment, aversion, clinging to life. (Sutra 2.3)

Viveka (Discernment).quote: हानमेषां क्लेशवदुक्तम्॥२.२५॥ - Liberation arises through discerning Purusha (Self) from Prakriti (nature). (Sutra 2.25)

Gunas (Qualities of Nature).quote: सत्वरजस्तमसां सम्यगवस्थानं कारणम्॥२.१८॥ - Sattva (clarity), Rajas (activity), Tamas (inertia) shape experience. (Sutra 2.18)

Kaivalya (Liberation).quote: तदा द्रष्टुः स्वरूपेऽवस्थानम्॥१.३॥ - Then the Seer abides in its true nature. (Sutra 1.3)

Aparigraha (Non-Grasping).quote: अपरिग्रहस्थैर्ये जन्मकथंतासंबोधः॥२.३९॥ - Freedom from greed reveals the why of birth. (Sutra 2.39)

Santosha (Contentment).quote: संतोषादनुत्तमः सुखलाभः॥२.४२॥ - Unsurpassed joy arises from contentment. (Sutra 2.42)

Svadhyaya (Self-Study).quote: स्वाध्यायादिष्टदेवतासंप्रयोगः॥२.४४॥ - Study leads to communion with the chosen ideal. (Sutra 2.44)

Siddhis (Powers).quote: जन्मौषधिमन्त्रतपःसमाधिजाः सिद्धयः॥४.१॥ - Siddhis arise from birth, herbs, mantras, austerity, or samadhi. (Sutra 4.1)

Maitri (Friendliness).quote: मैत्रीकरुणामुदितोपेक्षणां सुखदुःखपुण्यापुण्यविषयाणां भावनातश्चित्तप्रसादनम्॥१.३३॥ - Cultivate friendliness, compassion, joy, and equanimity. (Sutra 1.33)

Dharma Megha Samadhi.quote: धर्ममेघः समाधिः॥४.२९॥ - The 'cloud of dharma' samadhi: ultimate clarity. (Sutra 4.29)

Citta Prasadana (Purified Mind).quote: वितर्कबाधने प्रतिपक्षभावनम्॥२.३३॥ - Cultivate opposing thoughts to negate negativity. (Sutra 2.33)
